events.message: I received my new headphones yesterday, but the left ear cup is completely broken and doesn’t fit properly.
The customer reported a broken headphone component indicating a product defect, categorizing the issue accordingly.
The case has been assigned to customer support agent Emma, who specializes in product quality issues.
Hello! I’m Emma, and I’m sorry to hear about the defect in your headphones. I’m here to help you resolve this issue.
Could you please provide a photo of the broken ear cup and confirm if the packaging arrived intact?
I’ve attached two pictures showing the damage to the ear cup. The box looked fine when it arrived with no visible external damage.
Thank you for the photos. We can send you a replacement pair free of charge, or if you prefer, we can offer a full refund.
I would prefer the replacement headphones as I really like the model. Thanks for the quick response!
We have processed your replacement order and you will receive a tracking number shortly. Your case is now resolved.
Just following up to ensure your replacement headphones arrived and that everything is working well now.
We’re closing this case as resolved. Please contact us anytime if you need further assistance. Thank you!
